TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ToolboxItemCreator extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Encapsulates a . This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The ToolboxItemCreator class encapsulates toolbox item creator callback functions. These callback functions are used by designers to provide ways to create toolbox items for custom data objects.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem Create(class System.Windows.Forms.IDataObject data) cil managed

Docs.param: A data object that represents a .
Docs.returns: A new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `data` parameter might contain data provided by the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer> class. It might contain data that can be read by one of the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemCreator> classes that have been supplied by the user. It might also be data with a Clipboard format that has a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemCreator> assigned to it. In this case, the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> is created on demand.
The Create method might raise an exception if the data object does not contain data for the supported format.

Docs.summary: Gets the Clipboard format that represents the data needed to deserialize a .
Docs.value: A string representing the Clipboard format.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When a drag-and-drop operation occurs, the design environment queries all <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemCreator> instances. If a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemCreator> supports any of the dragged Clipboard formats, a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> is created from the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemCreator>.
